annotation.TEXT: Even though I had enough for the Ornate Plate, I actually wanted to wait until reaching a specific level to equip it (for reasons you'll see later). That, and if I had bought it here, I wouldn't have enough money to get into the upcoming extra stage.

With that done, it's time for the final extra stage. Frigid Flight is the last of the challenge stages, and although it's rather short, it's easily the toughest of the extra stages by far. It focuses on the use of the Propeller Dagger, along with combining stage elements from Polar Knight and Propeller Knight's levels.

The main goal for now is to get rid of all the ghosts in each area. The room's lights will turn on to indicate when you've cleared out a section. Incidentally, this also reveals a bit of an easter egg in the process. If you're wondering about all these paintings in the background, these are all apparently portraits of backers who donated $200 or more to this game while its Kickstarter event was still going.

Aside from the challenge stages (and the Streetpass Arena, if you're playing the 3DS version of this game), the Hall of Champions is another optional area that has some collectibles necessary for a 100% run (mainly in the form of music sheets). There are a few other quirks to this place as well, such as killing ghosts. Unlike it Specter Knight's stage, you can actually get rid of them here by knocking around orbs that produce shockwaves of light.

This segment will mostly be focusing on the last few extra collectibles and stages before moving on to the final levels. There's not much else to this aside from tying up some loose ends (and although it might not seem like it, buying all of the armor is actually necessary for a 100% run).

Once you light up all the rooms, there's one last thing standing between you and the end of the stage. The giant ghost is a bit more difficult than some of the main bosses, mainly because he can't be hurt through normal means. Thankfully, he actually shares in the main boss' traits of having no invincibility time after being hit, so you can effectively keep juggling the light orbs on him until he goes down (that is, unless he teleports or starts spinning around the room).
